alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 22 at 5:42AM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM MDT Sunday. For the High Wind Watch, from Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds expected this afternoon and evening, but the strongest winds are expected on Sunday. Winds slowly subside on Sunday night.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
